intro: Xanthosia collina, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sunhemp, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and hairy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in racemes. Xanthosia collina is often found in sandy or gravelly soils in arid and semi-arid regions. It is used in some areas for forage and has potential ecological benefits in soil stabilization.
